00019 #define DBG_DEMANGLE_PRINT_LEN 256  /* Num chars of demangled names to print */
00020 
00021 extern "C"
00022 {
00023     extern char *   cplusDemangle (char *source, char *dest, INT32 n);
00024 }
00025 
00026 char *wpiGetLabel(UINT addr, INT32 *found = NULL)
00027 {
00028     INT32 pVal;
00029     SYM_TYPE pType;
00030     char name[MAX_SYS_SYM_LEN + 1];
00031     static char label[DBG_DEMANGLE_PRINT_LEN + 1 + 11];
00032     bzero(label, DBG_DEMANGLE_PRINT_LEN + 1 + 11);
00033 
00034     if (symFindByValue(sysSymTbl, addr, name, &pVal, &pType) == OK)
00035     {
00036         cplusDemangle(name, label, sizeof(label) - 11);
00037         if ((UINT)pVal != addr)
00038         {
00039             sprintf(&label[strlen(label)], "+0x%04x", addr-pVal);
00040             if (found) *found = 2;
00041         }
00042         else
00043         {
00044             if (found) *found = 1;
00045         }
00046     }
00047     else
00048     {
00049         sprintf(label, "0x%04x", addr);
00050         if (found) *found = 0;
00051     }
00052 
00053     return label;
00054 }
00055 /*
00056 static void wpiTracePrint(INSTR *caller, INT32 func, INT32 nargs, INT32 *args, INT32 taskId, BOOL isKernelAdrs)
00057 {
00058     char buf [MAX_SYS_SYM_LEN * 2];
00059     INT32 ix;
00060     INT32 len = 0;
00061     len += sprintf (&buf [len], "%s <%#010x>: ", wpiGetLabel((UINT)caller), (INT32)caller);
00062     len += sprintf (&buf [len], "%s <%#010x> (", wpiGetLabel((UINT)func), func);
00063     for (ix = 0; ix < nargs; ix++)
00064     {
00065         if (ix != 0)
00066             len += sprintf (&buf [len], ", ");
00067         len += sprintf (&buf [len], "%#x", args [ix]);
00068     }
00069     len += sprintf (&buf [len], ")\n");
00070 
00071     printf(buf);
00072 }
00073 */
00074 static void wpiCleanTracePrint(INSTR *caller, INT32 func, INT32 nargs, INT32 *args, INT32 taskId, BOOL isKernelAdrs)
00075 {
00076     char buf [MAX_SYS_SYM_LEN];
00077     INT32 ix;
00078     INT32 len = 0;
00079     INT32 nameFound = 0;
00080     INT32 params = 0;
00081     INT32 totalnargs = nargs;
00082     char *funcName = wpiGetLabel((UINT)func, &nameFound);
00083     // Ignore names that are not exact symbol address matches.
00084     if (nameFound != 1) return;
00085 
00086     // Ignore internal function name matches.
00087     if (strncmp(funcName, "wpi_assert", 10) == 0) return;
00088     if (strncmp(funcName, "wpi_fatal", 9) == 0) return;
00089 
00090     // Find the number of arguments in the name string.
00091     char *start = strchr(funcName, '(');
00092     char *end = strrchr(funcName, ')');
00093     if (start + 1 != end && start != NULL)
00094     {
00095         do
00096         {
00097             params++;
00098             if(strncmp(start+1, "bool", 4) == 0 || strncmp(start+2, "bool", 4) == 0)
00099             {
00100                 totalnargs++;
00101             }
00102             start = strchr(start + 1, ',');
00103         }
00104         while(start < end && start != NULL);
00105     }
00106     char *funcNameEnd = strchr(funcName, '(');
00107     *funcNameEnd = 0;
00108     len += sprintf (&buf [len], funcName);
00109 
00110     // If this is a member function, print out the this pointer value.
00111     if (totalnargs - params == 1)
00112     {
00113         len += sprintf (&buf [len], "<this=%#x>", args [0]);
00114     }
00115 
00116     // Print out the argument values.
00117     len += sprintf (&buf [len], "(");
00118     for (ix = totalnargs - params; ix < nargs; ix++)
00119     {
00120         if (ix != totalnargs - params)
00121             len += sprintf (&buf [len], ", ");
00122         len += sprintf (&buf [len], "%#x", args [ix]);
00123     }
00124     len += sprintf (&buf [len], ")\n");
00125 
00126     printf(buf);
00127 }

00129 extern "C"
00130 {
00131     extern void trcStack(REG_SET* pRegs, FUNCPTR printRtn, INT32 tid);
00132 }
00133 
00134 static INT32 wpiStackTask(INT32 taskId)
00135 {
00136     taskDelay(1);
00137     //tt(taskId);
00138 
00139     REG_SET regs;
00140     taskRegsGet(taskId, &regs);
00141     trcStack(&regs, (FUNCPTR) wpiCleanTracePrint, taskId);
00142 
00143     // The task should be resumed because it had to be suspended to get the stack trace.
00144     taskResume(taskId);
00145     return 0;
00146 }
00147 
00148 static void wpiSelfTrace()
00149 {
00150     INT32 priority=100;
00151     taskPriorityGet(0, &priority);
00152     // Lower priority than the calling task.
00153     Task traceTask("StackTrace", (FUNCPTR)wpiStackTask, priority + 1);
00154     traceTask.Start(taskIdSelf());
00155 
00156     // Task to be traced must be suspended for the stack trace to work.
00157     taskSuspend(0);
00158 }

00160 static bool stackTraceEnabled = false;
00161 static bool suspendOnAssertEnabled = false;
00162 
00166 void wpi_stackTraceEnable(bool enabled)
00167 {
00168     stackTraceEnabled = enabled;
00169 }
00170 
00177 void wpi_suspendOnAssertEnabled(bool enabled)
00178 {
00179     suspendOnAssertEnabled = enabled;
00180 }
00181 
00182 static void wpi_handleTracing()
00183 {
00184     if (stackTraceEnabled)
00185     {
00186         printf("\n-----------<Stack Trace>----------------\n");
00187         wpiSelfTrace();
00188     }
00189     printf("\n");
00190 }

00197 bool wpi_assert_impl(bool conditionValue, 
00198                      const char *conditionText,
00199                      const char *message,
00200                      const char *fileName,
00201                      UINT32 lineNumber, 
00202                      const char *funcName)
00203 {
00204     if (!conditionValue)
00205     {   
00206         // Error string buffer
00207         char error[256];
00208                 
00209         // If an error message was specified, include it
00210         // Build error string
00211         if(message != NULL) {
00212             sprintf(error, "Assertion failed: \"%s\", \"%s\" failed in %s() in %s at line %d\n", 
00213                              message, conditionText, funcName, fileName, lineNumber);
00214         } else {
00215             sprintf(error, "Assertion failed: \"%s\" in %s() in %s at line %d\n", 
00216                              conditionText, funcName, fileName, lineNumber);
00217         }
00218         
00219         // Print to console and send to remote dashboard
00220         printf("\n\n>>>>%s", error);
00221         setErrorData(error, strlen(error), 100);
00222         
00223         wpi_handleTracing();
00224         if (suspendOnAssertEnabled) taskSuspend(0);
00225     }
00226     return conditionValue;
00227 }

00235                                  int valueB,
00236                                  const char *equalityType,
00237                                  const char *message,
00238                                  const char *fileName,
00239                                  UINT32 lineNumber, 
00240                                  const char *funcName)
00241 {
00242     // Error string buffer
00243     char error[256];
00244             
00245     // If an error message was specified, include it
00246     // Build error string
00247     if(message != NULL) {
00248         sprintf(error, "Assertion failed: \"%s\", \"%d\" %s \"%d\" in %s() in %s at line %d\n", 
00249                          message, valueA, equalityType, valueB, funcName, fileName, lineNumber);
00250     } else {
00251         sprintf(error, "Assertion failed: \"%d\" %s \"%d\" in %s() in %s at line %d\n", 
00252                          valueA, equalityType, valueB, funcName, fileName, lineNumber);
00253     }
00254     
00255     // Print to console and send to remote dashboard
00256     printf("\n\n>>>>%s", error);
00257     setErrorData(error, strlen(error), 100);
00258     
00259     wpi_handleTracing();
00260     if (suspendOnAssertEnabled) taskSuspend(0);
00261 }

00269 bool wpi_assertEqual_impl(int valueA,
00270                           int valueB,
00271                           const char *message,
00272                           const char *fileName,
00273                           UINT32 lineNumber, 
00274                           const char *funcName)
00275 {
00276     if(!(valueA == valueB))
00277     {
00278         wpi_assertEqual_common_impl(valueA, valueB, "!=", message, fileName, lineNumber, funcName);
00279     }
00280     return valueA == valueB;
00281 }

00289 bool wpi_assertNotEqual_impl(int valueA,
00290                              int valueB,
00291                              const char *message,
00292                              const char *fileName,
00293                              UINT32 lineNumber, 
00294                              const char *funcName)
00295 {
00296     if(!(valueA != valueB))
00297     {
00298         wpi_assertEqual_common_impl(valueA, valueB, "==", message, fileName, lineNumber, funcName);
00299     }
00300     return valueA != valueB;
00301 }

00306 void wpi_imaqAssert_impl(int imaqStatus, const char *message,
00307                             const char *fileName,
00308                             UINT32 lineNumber,
00309                             const char *funcName)
00310 {
00311     if (imaqStatus <= 0)
00312     {
00313         char err[64];
00314         sprintf(err, "%s: %d", message, imaqGetLastError());
00315         wpi_assertWithMessage(imaqStatus > 0, err);
00316     }
00317 }

00325 void wpi_assertCleanStatus_impl(INT32 status, const char *fileName, UINT32 lineNumber, const char *funcName)
00326 {
00327     if (status != 0)
00328     {
00329         // Error string buffers
00330         char error[256];
00331         char error_with_code[256];
00332         
00333         // Build error strings
00334         sprintf(error, "%s: status == %d (0x%08X) in %s() in %s at line %d\n",
00335                 status < 0 ? "ERROR" : "WARNING", status, (UINT32)status, funcName, fileName, lineNumber);
00336         sprintf(error_with_code,"<Code>%d %s", status, error);
00337         
00338         // Print to console and send to remote dashboard
00339         printf("\n\n>>>>%s", error);
00340         setErrorData(error_with_code, strlen(error_with_code), 100);
00341         
00342         wpi_handleTracing();
00343         if (suspendOnAssertEnabled) taskSuspend(0);
00344     }
00345 }

00348                     const char *fileName, UINT32 lineNumber, const char *funcName)
00349 {
00350     // Error string buffer
00351     char error[256];
00352 
00353     // Build error strings
00354     sprintf(error, "Fatal error \"%s\" in %s() in %s at line %d\n",
00355             statusString, funcName, fileName, lineNumber);
00356 
00357     // Print to console and send to remote dashboard
00358     printf("\n\n>>>>%s", error);
00359     setErrorData(error, strlen(error), 100);
00360 
00361     wpi_handleTracing();
00362 }

00370 UINT16 GetFPGAVersion()
00371 {
00372     tRioStatusCode status = 0;
00373     tGlobal global(&status);
00374     UINT16 version = global.readVersion(&status); 
00375     wpi_assertCleanStatus(status);
00376     return version;
00377 }

00421 INT32 GetRIOUserSwitch()
00422 {
00423     INT32 switchValue = UserSwitchInput(0);
00424     wpi_assert(switchValue >= 0);
00425     return switchValue > 0;
00426 }

00431 void SetRIOUserLED(UINT32 state)
00432 {
00433     LedOutput(0, state > 0);
00434 }
00435 
00440 INT32 GetRIOUserLED()
00441 {
00442     return LedInput(0);
00443 }

00449 INT32 ToggleRIOUserLED()
00450 {
00451     INT32 ledState = !GetRIOUserLED();
00452     SetRIOUserLED(ledState);
00453     return ledState;
